tier.item: (i) Le livre a eu été publié.
the book has had been published
(21) a. * Jean semble à Marie t avoir du talent.
J. seems to M. to have of talent
(`Jean seems to Marie to have talent.')
b. *À Marie semble t Jean avoir du talent.
to M. seems J. to have of talent
(`Jean seems to Marie to have talent.')
b. Quelle lettre Josèphe a-t-il écrite ?
c. la lettre que Josèphe a écrite hier
the-FEM letter that Joseph has written-FEM yesterday
(71) Je ferai manger les gâteaux à Jean.
1sg make.FUT eat the cakes to Jean
'I will make Jean eat the cakes.'
(16) a. Luc a fait acheter un livre aux étudiants.
L. has made buy a book (ACC) to.the students (DAT)
`Luc made the students buy a book'
b. Luc a fait travailler les étudiants
L. has made work.INF the students (ACC)
(17) Mes amis feront manger tous de la salade à ce garçon.
My friends will-make eat all of the salad to this boy
`All my friends will make this boy eat salad.'
Agnès 1SG . REC 3SG . M . THM present. FUT .3 SG
Agnès 1SG . THM 3SG . M . REC present. FUT .3 SG
c. Agnès me présentera à lui.
Agnès 1SG . THM present. FUT .3 SG to him
(43) a. Jean a repeint trios chaises.
b. Je laisserai Jean manger les gâteaux.
'I will let John eat the cakes.'
b. je ferai manger les gâteaux à Jean.
1sg make.FUT eat the cakes to John
'I will make John eat the cakes.'
(44) a. elle a fait manger du pain rassis à Abdou.
3fs PERF do eat-INF some bread old to Abdu
'She made Abdu eat an old bread.'
a. Lors la royne fist Santré appeller.
then the queen made Santré to-call.
` Then the queen had Saintré called'
c. Apres disner le chevalier me dist ...
after dinner the knight to-me said . . .
`After dinner the knight said to me . . .'
b. Il achète des jouets pour les petits-fils de ses petit-fils.
he buys some toys for the grandchildren of his grandchildren
"He's buying toys for his grandchildren's grandchildren."
a. Jean a dit à Paul [PRO être très fatigué]
Jean has said to P. be.inf very tired
"Jean has told Paul that he is very tired"
(24) Subject and object control with declarative verbs (French)
b. Jean a dit à Paul de [PRO partir]
Jean has said to P. of leave.inf
c. *il/c'est un livre que je vois.
It was a book that I saw.
b. Pierre lui-même a assisté à la conférence. (lui-même = reflexive)
Peter him-same has participated to the conference
b. Même le concierge a prononcé un discours. (focus particle)
even the janitor has pronounced a discourse
`Even the janitor has delivered a speech.'
(13) a. Avant de sortir, Marie s'habille et *(se) peigne soigneusement.
before to go out, Marie REFL dresses and (REFL) comb meticulously
`Before going out, Marie dresses and combs herself meticulously.'
(11) a. Quelle chance tu as eue! (Obenauer 1994:364)
(1) a. Les enfants ont chacun reçu un ballon.
The children have each received a balloon
`Each of the children received a balloon.'
F c. A qui a parlé Jean?
(i) a. Quelle femme crois-tu [que Pierre a rencontré __]?
which woman believe-you que Pierre has met
'Which woman do you believe that Pierre met?'
